pros: Students are encouraged to learn in a student centered environment. University classes are flexible enough to make schedule adjustments. Professors are highly talented, knowledgeable and keen to help students in any situation either personal or academic.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Vancouver, BC
pros: I feel immensely grateful to have the opportunity to work with a team of dedicated, engaging, supportive, and kind individuals at UCW. The company fosters a culture of positivity and health, which is crucial for promoting employee well-being. This is particularly evident in the HR management system, which exhibits a high level of professionalism and prioritizes the overall well-being of employees. I highly recommend this growing and expanding workplace to anyone seeking a supportive and fulfilling career.
cons: Office/work space might be limited

pros: Good environment Teamwork Disciplined Grow up
cons: Short time Limited positions Low Payment

review_title: A pretty good place to work for
pros: payment is not bad workload is controlled by instructors no interference from the university on teaching students are mostly friendly and nice
cons: To be honest, I do not have many complaints. Sessional instructors are treated as temps, no benefits, no employment security. But this is what it means by "sessional".

review_title: Best place to work if you are up for a challenge
pros: I am glad that UCW exists. During my tenure at UCW, I have seen some massive improvements over the last three years. As it is a mid size university, you can take on many responsibilities if you like a challenge. Unlike big university or colleges, you are NOT limited to teach one or two courses. You can teach a heavy load if courses are offered. The pay has improved significantly and is in par with other universities now. You will get rewarded if you are willing to work hard. The best part is that you will get an opportunity to take on higher level roles if you perform and are willing to take risks. Again, I am glad UCW is there to support me.
cons: Some rules, policies, and regulations need to be updated. I think there should be a bit of a better screening of students enrolling into the instituion. Cheating cases are on rise and school needs to do something about it. Course outlines are barely read by anyone and yet faculty spends hours creating an outline Emails should be promptly corresponded.

pros: job is on campus, easier to attend classes, and interact with team members.
cons: it is not a high paying job. can be distracted from study

pros: Course payment is fair for number of students
cons: -Students can be abusive towards profs and no one cares -The tail wags the dog there. -Most Universities wouldn't give much weight to a grade dispute-(if a student wants an A+ and gets an A) the recently appointed Academic department leader-gives more weight to the students- then the profs -It is a private University , not government funded,without faculty protection, so somewhat like the Wild West without proper controls and protection put in place for faculty

pros: Company offers a competitive compensation package and has a high trust environment. Onboarding was smooth and quick! Love the openness to feedback.
cons: Lacks space for staff so we do hybrid work arrangement which works.

pros: The campus is nice and located in downtown, but no STAFF parking is available. It's in an expensive area, far from a Train station, and close to bus stations.
cons: Pay is very low and unfair. The management leaders change frequently, and the team lost their direction sometimes too.

pros: Amazing colleagues, a new direction with knowledge over profit philosophy with a professional and strong President (Levy)and VPA as of 2022, student-focused, a new focus on research, part of GUS Global, space for teaching experience and contributing to a growth environment. State of the art campus.
cons: Minimal faculty consultation on policy/procedure/process etc, as faculty you can’t actually speak to anyone for support links to forms (same for students), the lack of integration and collaboration between departments e.g., student affairs, IT, academic dept stove piping is hampering growth, quality and employee satisfaction. Department leadership is not in tune with the reality of the front line and push back when issues are raised.  Profit over people organization is still the driving force at the ‘senior’ and ‘director’ levels.

pros:
It's really hard to list any. 
Maybe Fresh fruits days (Wednesday's) !?
cons:
- Toxic and unprofessional environment
- Low quality education
- If you did extra work, you need to run for months to get paid for the work!
- No one has the habit of responding to emails! A full time faculty does not get their emails responded for weeks! 
- 1-2 department chairs does not even have a solid education (forget about academic leadership) and no ideas what they are doing. 
- This university is printing MBA degrees to those who can pay the price!
- Fake reviews: As someone who worked here for more than 2 years, I can confidently say all 5-star reviews are fake!

job_title: Online History Instructor in Vancouver, BC
pros: Vancouver's a great city to live in and work.
cons: I taught one online Canadian History course for six weeks, mostly to international students. Delivery had to be online due to COVID. For instructors using an online learning platform for the first time, as I was, this is not the place for you. Unless you live in Vancouver, and can visit the school in person, you will be hung out to dry by the staff when you have technical problems with the platform. No one at UCW seems to be responsible for fielding questions from instructors struggling with the book-keeping demands. Every time I touched base for help, it was like I was asking a personal favor to get answers. When using a platform there are plenty of small hiccups and obstacles first-time users face, the type of problems that can usually be fixed quickly with an IT department. UCW, however, simply provides you with the online learning tutorials and expects everything to go smoothly. My supervisor, or subject lead, asked me to include him in my last lecture. Said it was easy. In fact, it was so easy, he couldn't explain what to do to invite him into the class. No one else could or would either. After my exam, I spent the entire Christmas holidays honing and improving my lectures. Then found out I didn't have a class to teach in January. Even they admitted to this bumbling oversight. Asking why, I was simultaneously informed that I didn't have a class because enrolment was down in the new year AND that my book-keeping (grades, attendance) online was poor, BY THE SAME professor who expected to observe my last class, but couldn't explain how to include him online.

pros: It's fun to work with students and co-workers are easy to get along with.
cons: Lots of company politics and high turn over rate with highier management

review_title: Great workplace and faculty to work with
job_title: Administrative Assistant, Office of the Registrar in Vancouver, BC
pros: The people I worked with at UCW are some of the best, incredible and friendly people I have ever met. Extremely friendly and respectful, helping to create a great atmosphere in office. Location is perfect as it is located in downtown Vancouver. Finally, the work load is reasonable and manageable.
cons: Paper-based university which is slowly transforming into a more electronic system. No marketing plan as such, it is not that well known amongst other universities. The management team are extremely nice people but sometimes, do not try to understand the people in other offices which bring forward frustrations towards them as well as overworking the staff, further devaluing some of the staff.  Also leads to a lack of understanding and communication between different departments.

job_title: Administrative Assistant/Event Coordinator in Vancouver, BC
pros:
UCW is a place that promotes inclusion, diversity, innovation, and collaboration. They provide professional and personal development.
The President and senior management go out of their way to be open and accessible to all staff.
Employee Engagement is definitely a high priority at UCW. Prior to the COVID 19 conditions being in place there was at least one type of activity every month.
I feel that during this time of COVID 19 they are truly 100% concerned of the well being of their staff. 
I hope to work for UCW for as long as I can.
cons: Tight on office, meeting room and storage space but that will change once the new Campus opens up

review_title: Love being a part of this dynamic university that promotes innovation and staff to think out of the box.
pros: The downtown Vancouver location is great. I can take the subway to work and its really convenient. Colleagues and line managers are not afraid to get their hands dirty and often walk the talk.  I look forward to coming to work everyday.
cons: The University is very process and quality assurance driven. Hence there are lots of paperwork involved. This means approvals could take a little longer due to all the checks and balance.
